title: Ticket #1355: Reset_Timer/ResetTimer one-off timer to periodic should be illegal
description:
Hypothesis: Converting a one-off timer (timer with a period of 0) into a periodic timer (period > 0), is deeply suspicious. A one-off timer is always either truly one-off ("Go do this task") or is automatically resubmitting itself. Redoing that would range from incorrect and harmless through incorrect and crippling (#1337). I can't think of any non-insane reasons to use DaemonCore::Reset_Timer or TimerManager::ResetTimer to convert a one-off timer into a periodic one.

Proposal: As such, doing so should trigger an EXCEPTion. This would catch bugs like #1337 quickly instead of creating hard to debug bugs.

To do: Check our various one-off timers. Do we ever intentionally convert them to periodic timers?
